title: Did Eminem ghostwrite for Dr Dre on 'Forgot About Dre'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, Eminem wrote his verse. Dr dre is a legendary producer, but he always had his verses written by someone else. Ice cube wrote his verses in N.W.A.The chronic (1992) was written by Doc, Xhibit, Snoop dogg and some others.Jay-z wrote Still dre and The watcher on Chronic 2001, Eminem wrote forget about dre and many others were involved in some others song.Game also wrote some of his verses.Kendrick lamar wrote his verse for the recipe(Kendrick lamar song on his debut album Good kid Maad city).I am not disrespecting Dr dre in any way, shape or form. He is legend. He is arguably the best producer in the history of hip hop. If it was not for Dr Dre, we would not have EminemSnoop doggIce cubeNWAThe gameKendrick lamar( Good kid Maad city was produced by Dre and he is also signed to Aftermath and Tde)50 cent (him and Eminem exe. Produced Get rich or die trying, he produced the song In the club)He is a legend, without him West coast hip hop would not be what it is.

Want to start by saying doctor Dre is a musical revolutionary. His influence on hip hop is unquestionable so answering this question by no means is taking any thing from him. To answer question ..yes most if not all of chronic “2001” album was ghost writtin by various artists including Eminem,also Jay z, Royce 59 had there ink on it. Weather his projects before that were him writing it or not I don't know. But anyone who has an ear/appreciation for lyricism on any advanced level such as multi syllable rhyme schemes and word play can easily tell how drastically different his lyrical skill is from his pre Eminem career. One of the greatest examples is the song “watcher” which has Eminem all over it. The ingenious rhymes schemes and rhyming words that don't usually rhyme is something em is renown for. Not saying that Dre can't rap him self but as far as lyrics go he didn't just rap a certain way his whole life then over nite meet Eminem and become such a high level lyricist on his own. Obviously one if not greatest producers ever and makes great records so mad respect to him. This is just answering question from lyrical ghost writing stand point nothing more ,nothing less.

Eminem wrote Dre’s lyrics for “Forgot about Dre. When it comes to producing, Dr. Dre is in my personal Top 3 or all time yet he ALWAYS had someone writing his lyrics. For the “Chronic 2001” album, alot of his verses were written by Jay-Z. You can hear a lot of Jay-Z’s style and cadence on “Still DRE.” But Ultimately, Em did the writing for Dre on and my track in which they both appeared.

Yes. Dr.Dre himself said that Em came to him with this song completely written with a racy rap flow to go with it, making it a challenge for Dre considering this was the first time he had to create and construct a beat to go specifically to these already finished lyrics and rythym.
